definition: to take a test or exam for sb
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father

sentences.english: And in that dream rich kids don't pay people to take the SAT.
sentences.chinese: 在這個夢裏，富家子不花錢請人代考。

sentences.english: The two exams coincide with each other, take one for me?
sentences.chinese: 兩個考試同一時間，幫我代考一個吧？

definition: to practice fraud/to cheat/to engage in corrupt practices
to assume sb's name and take his place (idiom); to impersonate/to pose under a false name
to sit for a makeup exam/to resit an exam/makeup exam/resit
to teach as substitute for absent teacher
to write as substitute for sb/a ghost writer/plagiarism
lack of discipline/to break a rule/to violate discipline/to breach a principle
lit. to enter by the back door/fig. to gain influence by pull or unofficial channels/back door or under the counter connections
to generate fake transactions in order to game a commercial online platform (one that rewards users who make numerous transactions)
